meanings.definition: Either of the two times in the year when the sun is at its greatest distance from the celestial equator
meanings.sent1: During the solstices, the sun appears to stand still in the sky.
meanings.sent2: People celebrate the solstices with special ceremonies and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The solstices are like nature's way of saying 'time to switch things up!'
meanings.sent4: The solstices mark the extreme points of the sun's journey across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The solstices are like the bookmarks of the year, holding the pages of seasons together.

meanings.definition: The time of year when the sun reaches its highest or lowest point in the sky at noon, marked by the longest and shortest days
meanings.sent1: At the solstices, the sun seems to linger longer in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Many cultures have festivals during the solstices to honor the sun.
meanings.sent3: The solstices are like the sun's way of playing peek-a-boo with the earth.
meanings.sent4: During the solstices, the sun's rays feel like a warm embrace from above.
meanings.sent5: The solstices paint the sky with the colors of dawn and dusk, blending light and dark.
